content:
Below are Tracker items and proposed dispositions for the US Core R4 Implementation Guide block vote on the Nov 13th US Realm Steering Committee call. We have preapplied several of them so you can preview. If you have any questions or would like to pull an item - contact Eric Haas or Brett Marquard.

Additionally, we will be voting to approve submitting the US Core R4 Implementation Guide for the January Ballot.

Tracker Items

Commenters

  • Eric Haas
  • Floyd Eisenberg
  • Freida Hall
  • Gary Dickinson
  • Grahame Grieve
  • Ioana Singureanu
  • Jay Lyle
  • Kensaku Kawamoto
  • Linda Michaelsen
  • Mark Kramer
  • Michelle Miller
  • Rick Geimer
  • Robert McClure
  • Rute Martins
  • Sean McIlvenna

Line Items

  • GF#13902 Consider+qicore-encounter+for+the+uscore+encounter+profile (Bryn Rhodes) Considered - Question Answered
  • GF#13127 For+MedicationStatement+Profile+consider+whether+the+encounter+should+be+must-support (Eric Haas) Considered for Future Use
  • GF#13937 Align+US+Core+value+sets+with+recent+C-CDA+updates (Rick Geimer) Considered for Future Use
  • GF#14388 US+Core%3A++Require+Provenance+Resource+for+Create%2FUpdate%2FDelete+Events%2C+AuditEvent+for+Read (Gary Dickinson) In Person Considered for Future Use
  • GF#18085 Consider+the+QICore-Coverage+profile+for+inclusion+in+US+Core (Bryn Rhodes) Considered for Future Use
  • GF#14257 US+Core+doesn%27t+allow+for+%22notDone%22+procedure (Mark Kramer) Not Persuasive
  • GF#16066 USCore+detailed+race+and+detailed+ethnicity+exclude+category+codes (Robert McClure) Not Persuasive
  • GF#16515 Detailed+Race+value+set+should+not+exclude+race+category+codes (Robert McClure) Not Persuasive
  • GF#13642 change+references+to+US-Core-Profiles+in+US+Core+CareTeam+profile (Eric Haas) Persuasive
  • GF#15591 change+all+occurrences+of+lab+to+laboratory (Eric Haas) Persuasive
  • GF#15999 Document+how+deleted+records+should+be+handled (Grahame Grieve) Persuasive
  • GF#16104 Use+short+list+of+allergy+substances (Jay Lyle) In Person Persuasive
  • GF#17400 What+does+authoritative+identifier+mean+in+US+Core+%28Practitioner+and+Organization%29%3F (Michelle Miller) Persuasive
  • GF#17444 fix+mapping+url+%28+remove+spaces%29 (David Hay) Persuasive
  • GF#17679 Fix+Language+Value+Set+Expansion (Ioana Singureanu) Persuasive
  • GF#17803 Value+set+definition+URLs+are+broken (Rute Martins) Persuasive
  • GF#18155 US+Core+enhancement+request+to+add+ACLA+best+practice+guidance (Freida Hall) Persuasive
  • GF#19337 fix+the+id+elements+in+the+extensions (Eric Haas) Persuasive
  • GF#19539 make+download+link+obvious (Eric Haas) Persuasive
  • GF#13180 US_Core+Medication+constraint+1..1+.code+dose+not+allow+for+compounded+meds (Eric Haas) Persuasive with Mod
  • GF#15513 Vital+Signs+say+it+uses+FHIR+Core (Linda Michaelsen) Persuasive with Mod
  • GF#15927 DosageInstruction.text+should+be+required+for+providing+the+Sig. (Kensaku Kawamoto) Persuasive with Mod
  • GF#15944 Identify+Principal+Diagnosis (Floyd Eisenberg) In Person Persuasive with Mod
  • GF#17720 Resources+in+US+Core+should+have+better+%28more+unique%29+.id+values (Sean McIlvenna) Persuasive with Mod
Seeking implementer input on what guidance to provide for GF#15999 especially from those who raised the issue....

Seeking implementer input on what guidance to provide for GF#15999 especially from those who raised the issue....

I provided guidance in followup on the change request.

John, on a technical level, do you think setting the status to "entered-in-error" and removing/blanking-out all data elements is acceptable for all the cases you highlight or are there instances where a resource absolutely must disappear? I'm trying to figure out if the IG can mandate to never delete a resource but instead return an entered-in-error resource (and also return these resources on searches that don't limit the status) or whether full deletion should be possible, only requiring a status 410 to be returned upon read.
What we should want to avoid is that Resources are being deleted and a read returns a 404.

Since the HL7 ig-autobuilder is temporarily unavailable for R4 igs, https://healthedata1.github.io/TEMPUSCORE4/ is a link to a temporary site for the US Core R4 for review of preapplied tracker items only.
Note that this is a minimal ig due github pages folder size limits. I have removed the xml, json or ttl views as well as examples from this temporary site.

updated IG is here with new section on clinical notes:

http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core-R4/index.html
